text:
e="preserve">In computer science, a linked list is a data structure that is a linear collection of items whose order is not given by their physical placement in memory. Instead, each item links to the next item. The last item links to a terminator used to mark the end of the list.
Singly linked list.
"A singly linked list whose items have two fields: a value and a link to the next item"
Doubly linked list.
"A doubly linked list whose items have three fields: a value, the link forward to the next item, and the link backward to the previous item"
